meanings.sent1: The lacheses of the students were left unattended in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The teacher collected the lacheses from the students at the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: The lacheses decided to have a party while the teacher was away.
meanings.sent4: The lacheses piled up in the lost and found like forgotten treasures.
meanings.sent5: The colorful lacheses brightened up the dull classroom.

meanings.definition: Laches: negligence in the performance of a duty
meanings.sent1: The laches of the guard led to a security breach.
meanings.sent2: The company faced consequences due to the laches in their safety protocols.
meanings.sent3: The laches of the chef resulted in a burnt dinner.
meanings.sent4: Her laches in studying caused her to fail the exam.
meanings.sent5: The laches in maintenance caused the machine to break down.
